channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside 24/22 Allcroft Road, 11th February
item.description:
This tree was reported dead last year and has now been removed in Oct/Nov time, but the tree has not been replaced. Please advise when it will be replaced and I appreciate it may be after the frost, but please advice on when this will be and I want to check it does not get forgotten about. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Allcroft Road, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on southborough road at the intersection, south facing, 11th February
item.description:
Pothole cannot be seen from the roundabout side due to its raised elevation, resulting in many drivers hitting it. Pothole has been there for about 1-2 weeks now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Road, Southborough, Greater London

item.title: Blocked Drain, 11th February
item.description:
The drain is blocked again leaving floods of water located on the Friern Barnet pavement where drain is blocked and if I do not sweep The next drain outside 37a often from the debris than I have pool of water on my drive, making it ridiculously difficult for me to enter and exit my vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Friern Barnet Lane, Friern Barnet, Greater London

item.description:
Caused a blow out to tyre and had to get recovery to come - Â£120 on a new tyre

item.title: Deep Pothole end of New Eltham Station Road SE9 2AB, 11th February
item.description:
I don't care if this has been reported or not because my life could of been taken today. As I walked passed this pothole a car went over it and nearly lost control causing the car to swivel. Thankfully you're not being sued. The car tyre must of been damaged as I heard a popping sound. The car continued and must of stopped further down Footscray Road. This is URGENT this nearly took my life today so let's make sure this doesn't take a life anytime soon.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Station Approach New Eltham, New Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fuel/oil spillage, 11th February
item.description:
There is a spillage of oil or diesel fuel on the top of Dinsdale Road near the junction with Humber Road, it has run down the road and is mainbly in the kerbside, but there was some on the pavement too and it was very slippery
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dinsdale Road, Blackheath

item.title: Bushes on the pavement, 11th February
item.description:
That bushes were there for a long time. But not many people use that footpath. Since new bus route SL11 (with reduced stops) started operating that footpath becomes important to maty residents of Thamesmead. As you can see from the photos 1 person can barely walk through and it's almost impossible for parent with buggy or wheelchair users. Also that place in roundabout with obstruct visibility (you can also see that onpthotos).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin !!!!!!!, 11th February
item.description:
Last week, no one emptied the bin. Yesterday, the garbage collectors came and didn't empty it either. The trash no longer fits, and the bin room can't be closed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gloucester Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter picking is needed along Talfourd Rd, 11th February
item.description:
Please send a team to litter pick along Talfourd road on a regular basis. I saw that litter was picked twice in 2025. Please could litter picking be done at least once a week (preferably on Wednesday afternoons after the refuse and garden waste collections). In the past this was the approach (once weekly litter pick, timed appropriately) but has declined to approximately twice a year. The location is all of Talfourd road. the issue has been present for a number of years and the care for this street has been in general decline. Thank you in advance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Talfourd Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road breaking up around manhole cover, 11th February
item.description:
There is large chunks of tarmac across the road from an increasing large and deep hole next to a man hole cover which is in danger of collapsing. It is also an increased risk of causing a road traffic accident.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Porcupine Close, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavements and road edges need weeding along Talfourd road., 11th February
item.description:
Pavements and road edges need weeding along Talfourd road. The location is all along Talfourd rd on the pavements and road edges. The last time this was done was in 2025. Thank you in advance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Talfourd Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Autumn leaves need clearing along Talfourd Road., 11th February
item.description:
Please clear all Autumn leaves from along Talfourd Road and off the pavements. It was partially cleared on two occasions in 2025 but due to the lack of care in this area and on this street leaves are still present and soddened causing mess and safety issues. The exact location can not be exact, the entire street needs sweeping and cleaning. The issue has been present since Autumn (October 2025). Thank you in advance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Talfourd Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The glass in shelter fell out, 11th February
item.description:
A pane of glass fell out of the shelter and narrowly missed an elderly man. Some teenagers stood the glass up against the shelter. This pane of glass is very sharp and not very visible, and will cause a danger to passers by

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 349, Ballards Lane, North Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - smashed glass or panels / jagged metal edges on shelter

item.title: Abandoned bins filled with rubbish, 11th February
item.description:
There are two bins along the left hand side of Hengist Rd towards the end of the road nearer Ethelbert Rd. These bins have been there for months and months, not labelled with a door number and they are being used to dump rubbish in. You can see by condition of bins and increasing rubbish these are abandoned and attracting foxes

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hengist Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
